22class hotkey_queue;
23#if !defined(__ANDROID__)
24class keybindings_ui;
25#endif
26namespace catacurses
27{
28class window;
29} // namespace catacurses
30
31/**
32 * Represents a context in which a set of actions can be performed.
33 *
34 * This class is responsible for registering possible actions
35 * (traditionally keypresses), handling input, and yielding the correct
36 * action string descriptors for given input.
37 *
38 * This turns this class into an abstraction method between actual
39 * input(keyboard, gamepad etc.) and game.
40 */
41class input_context
42{
43#if !defined(__ANDROID__)
44 friend class keybindings_ui;
45#endif
46 public:
47#if defined(__ANDROID__)
48 // Whatever's on top is our current input context.
49 static std::list<input_context *> input_context_stack;
50#endif
51
52 input_context() : registered_any_input( false ), category( "default" ),
53 coordinate_input_received( false ), handling_coordinate_input( false ) {
54#if defined(__ANDROID__)
55 input_context_stack.push_back( this );
56 allow_text_entry = false;
57#endif
58 register_action( "toggle_language_to_en" );
59 }
60 // TODO: consider making the curses WINDOW an argument to the constructor, so that mouse input
61 // outside that window can be ignored
62 explicit input_context( const std::string &category,
63 const keyboard_mode preferred_keyboard_mode = keyboard_mode::keycode )
64 : registered_any_input( false ), category( category ),
65 coordinate_input_received( false ), handling_coordinate_input( false ),
66 preferred_keyboard_mode( preferred_keyboard_mode ) {
67#if defined(__ANDROID__)
68 input_context_stack.push_back( this );
69 allow_text_entry = false;
70#endif
71 register_action( "toggle_language_to_en" );
72 }
73
74#if defined(__ANDROID__)
75 virtual ~input_context() {
76 input_context_stack.remove( this );
77 }
78
79 // HACK: hack to allow creating manual keybindings for getch() instances, uilists etc. that don't use an input_context outside of the Android version
80 struct manual_key {
81 manual_key( int _key, const std::string &_text ) : key( _key ), text( _text ) {}
82 int key;
83 std::string text;
84 bool operator==( const manual_key &other ) const {
85 return key == other.key && text == other.text;
86 }
87 };
88
89 std::vector<manual_key> registered_manual_keys;
90
91 // If true, prevent virtual keyboard from dismissing after a key press while this input context is active.
92 // NOTE: This won't auto-bring up the virtual keyboard, for that use sdltiles.cpp is_string_input()
93 bool allow_text_entry;
94
95 void register_manual_key( manual_key mk );
96 void register_manual_key( int key, const std::string text = "" );
97
98 std::string get_action_name_for_manual_key( int key ) {
99 for( const auto &manual_key : registered_manual_keys ) {
100 if( manual_key.key == key ) {
101 return manual_key.text;
102 }
103 }
104 return std::string();
105 }
106 std::vector<manual_key> &get_registered_manual_keys() {
107 return registered_manual_keys;
108 }
109
110 std::string &get_category() {
111 return category;
112 }
113 std::vector<std::string> &get_registered_actions() {
114 return registered_actions;
115 }
116 bool is_action_registered( const std::string &action_descriptor ) const {
117 return std::find( registered_actions.begin(), registered_actions.end(),
118 action_descriptor ) != registered_actions.end();
119 }
120
121 input_context &operator=( const input_context &other ) {
122 registered_actions = other.registered_actions;
123 registered_manual_keys = other.registered_manual_keys;
124 allow_text_entry = other.allow_text_entry;
125 registered_any_input = other.registered_any_input;
126 category = other.category;
127 coordinate = other.coordinate;
128 coordinate_input_received = other.coordinate_input_received;
129 handling_coordinate_input = other.handling_coordinate_input;
130 next_action = other.next_action;
131 iso_mode = other.iso_mode;
132 action_name_overrides = other.action_name_overrides;
133 timeout = other.timeout;
134 return *this;
135 }
136
137 bool operator==( const input_context &other ) const {
138 return category == other.category &&
139 registered_actions == other.registered_actions &&
140 registered_manual_keys == other.registered_manual_keys &&
141 allow_text_entry == other.allow_text_entry &&
142 registered_any_input == other.registered_any_input &&
143 coordinate == other.coordinate &&
144 coordinate_input_received == other.coordinate_input_received &&
145 handling_coordinate_input == other.handling_coordinate_input &&
146 next_action == other.next_action &&
147 iso_mode == other.iso_mode &&
148 action_name_overrides == other.action_name_overrides &&
149 timeout == other.timeout;
150 }
151 bool operator!=( const input_context &other ) const {
152 return !( *this == other );
153 }
154#endif
155
156 /**
157 * Register an action with this input context.
158 *
159 * Only registered actions will be returned by `handle_input()`, it's
160 * thus possible to have multiple actions associated with the same keypress,
161 * as long as they don't ever occur in the same input context.
162 *
163 * If `action_descriptor` is the special "ANY_INPUT", instead of ignoring
164 * unregistered keys, those keys will all be linked to this "ANY_INPUT"
165 * action.
166 *
167 * If `action_descriptor` is the special "COORDINATE", coordinate input will be processed
168 * and the specified coordinates can be retrieved using `get_coordinates()`. Currently the
169 * only form of coordinate input is mouse input(you can directly click coordinates on
170 * the screen).
171 *
172 * @param action_descriptor String of action id.
173 */
174 void register_action( const std::string &action_descriptor );
175
176 /**
177 * Same as other @ref register_action function but allows a context specific
178 * action name. The given name is displayed instead of the name taken from
179 * the @ref input_manager.
180 *
181 * @param action_descriptor String of action id.
182 * @param name Name of the action, displayed to the user. If empty use the
183 * name reported by the input_manager.
184 */
185 void register_action( const std::string &action_descriptor, const translation &name );
186
187 /**
188 * Get the set of available single character keyboard keys that do not
189 * conflict with any registered hotkeys. The result will only include
190 * characters from the requested_keys parameter that have no conflicts
191 * i.e. the set difference requested_keys - conflicts.
192 *
193 * @param requested_keys The set of single character hotkeys to
194 * potentially use. Defaults to all printable ascii.
195 *
196 * @return Returns the set of non-conflicting, single character keyboard
197 * keys suitable for use as hotkeys.
198 */
199 std::string get_available_single_char_hotkeys(
200 std::string requested_keys =
201 "abcdefghijkpqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789-=:;'\",./<>?!@#$%^&*()_+[]\\{}|`~" );
202
203 using input_event_filter = std::function<bool( const input_event & )>;
204
205 // Helper functions to be used as @ref input_event_filter
206 static bool disallow_lower_case_or_non_modified_letters( const input_event &evt );
207 static bool allow_all_keys( const input_event &evt );
208
209 /**
210 * Get a description text for the key/other input method associated
211 * with the given action. If there are multiple bound keys, no more
212 * than max_limit will be described in the result. In addition, only
213 * keys satisfying evt_filter will be described.
214 *
215 * @param action_descriptor The action descriptor for which to return
216 * a description of the bound keys.
217 *
218 * @param max_limit No more than max_limit bound keys will be
219 * described in the returned description. A value of
220 * 0 indicates no limit.
221 *
222 * @param evt_filter Only keys satisfying this function will be
223 * described.
224 */
225 std::string get_desc( const std::string &action_descriptor,
226 unsigned int max_limit = 0,
227 const input_event_filter &evt_filter = allow_all_keys ) const;
228
229 /**
230 * Get a description based on `text`. If a bound key for `action_descriptor`
231 * satisfying `evt_filter` is contained in `text`, surround the key with
232 * brackets and change the case if necessary (e.g. "(Y)es"). Otherwise
233 * prefix `text` with description of the first bound key satisfying
234 * `evt_filter`, surrounded in square brackets (e.g "[RETURN] Yes").
235 *
236 * @param action_descriptor The action descriptor for which to return
237 * a description of the bound keys.
238 *
239 * @param text The base text for action description
240 *
241 * @param evt_filter Only keys satisfying this function will be considered
242 * @param inline_fmt Action description format when a key is found in the
243 * text (for example "(a)ctive")
244 * @param separate_fmt Action description format when a key is not found
245 * in the text (for example "[X] active" or "[N/A] active")
246 */
247 std::string get_desc( const std::string &action_descriptor,
248 const std::string &text,
249 const input_event_filter &evt_filter,
250 const translation &inline_fmt,
251 const translation &separate_fmt ) const;
252 std::string get_desc( const std::string &action_descriptor,
253 const std::string &text,
254 const input_event_filter &evt_filter = allow_all_keys ) const;
255
256 /**
257 * Equivalent to get_desc( act, get_action_name( act ), filter )
258 **/
259 std::string describe_key_and_name( const std::string &action_descriptor,
260 const input_event_filter &evt_filter = allow_all_keys ) const;
261
262 /**
263 * Handles input and returns the next action in the queue.
264 *
265 * This internally calls getch() or whatever other input method
266 * is available(e.g. gamepad).
267 *
268 * If the action is mouse input, returns "MOUSE".
269 *
270 * @return One of the input actions formerly registered with
271 * `register_action()`, or "ERROR" if an error happened.
272 *
273 */
274 const std::string &handle_input();
275 const std::string &handle_input( int timeout );
276
277 /**
278 * Convert a direction action (UP, DOWN etc) to a delta vector.
279 *
280 * @return If the action is a movement action (UP, DOWN, ...),
281 * the delta vector associated with it. Otherwise returns an empty value.
282 * The returned vector will always have a z component of 0.
283 */
284 // TODO: Get rid of untyped version and change name of the typed one.
285 std::optional<tripoint> get_direction( const std::string &action ) const;
286 std::optional<tripoint_rel_ms> get_direction_rel_ms( const std::string &action ) const;
287
288 /**
289 * Get the coordinates associated with the last mouse click (if any).
290 */
291 std::optional<tripoint> get_coordinates( const catacurses::window &capture_win_,
292 const point &offset = point_zero, bool center_cursor = false ) const;
293
294 // Below here are shortcuts for registering common key combinations.
295 void register_directions();
296 void register_updown();
297 void register_leftright();
298 void register_cardinal();
299 void register_navigate_ui_list();
300
301 /**
302 * Display the possible actions in the current context and their
303 * keybindings.
304 * @param permit_execute_action If `true` the function allows the user to specify an action to execute
305 * @return action_id of any action the user specified to execute, or ACTION_NULL if none
306 */
307 action_id display_menu( bool permit_execute_action = false );
308 private:
309 /**
310 * Reset action to default keybindings.
311 * Prompt the user to resolve conflicts if they arise.
312 * @return true if keybinding changed
313 */
314 bool action_reset( const std::string &action_id );
315 /**
316 * Prompt the user to add an event to an action.
317 * Prompt the user to resolve conflicts if they arise.
318 * @return true if keybinding changed
319 */
320 bool action_add( const std::string &name, const std::string &action_id, bool is_local,
321 kb_menu_status status );
322 /**
323 * Remove an action.
324 * Prompt the user to resolve conflicts if they arise.
325 * @return true if keybinding changed
326 */
327 bool action_remove( const std::string &name, const std::string &action_id, bool is_local,
328 bool is_empty );
329 public:
330
331 /**
332 * Temporary method to retrieve the raw input received, so that input_contexts
333 * can be used in screens where not all possible actions have been defined in
334 * keybindings.json yet.
335 */
336 input_event get_raw_input();
337
338 /**
339 * Get coordinate of text level from mouse input, difference between this and get_coordinates is that one is getting pixel level coordinate.
340 */
341 std::optional<point> get_coordinates_text( const catacurses::window &capture_win ) const;
342
343 /**
344 * Get the human-readable name for an action.
345 */
346 std::string get_action_name( const std::string &action_id ) const;
347
348 /* For the future, something like this might be nice:
349 * const std::string register_action(const std::string& action_descriptor, x, y, width, height);
350 * (x, y, width, height) would describe an area on the visible window that, if clicked, triggers the action.
351 */
352
353 // (Press X (or Y)|Try) to Z
354 std::string press_x( const std::string &action_id ) const;
355 std::string press_x( const std::string &action_id, const std::string &key_bound,
356 const std::string &key_unbound ) const;
357 std::string press_x( const std::string &action_id, const std::string &key_bound_pre,
358 const std::string &key_bound_suf, const std::string &key_unbound ) const;
359
360 /**
361 * Keys (and only keys, other input types are not included) that
362 * trigger the given action.
363 * @param action_descriptor The action descriptor for which to get the bound keys.
364 * @param maximum_modifier_count Maximum number of modifiers allowed for
365 * the returned action. <0 means any number is allowed.
366 * @param restrict_to_printable If `true`, the function returns the bound
367 * keys only if they are printable (space counts as non-printable
368 * here). If `false`, all keys (whether they are printable or not)
369 * are returned.
370 * @param restrict_to_keyboard If `true`, the function returns the bound keys only
371 * if they are keyboard inputs. If `false`, all inputs, such as mouse
372 * inputs are included.
373 * @returns All keys bound to the given action descriptor.
374 */
375 std::vector<input_event> keys_bound_to( const std::string &action_descriptor,
376 int maximum_modifier_count = -1,
377 bool restrict_to_printable = true,
378 bool restrict_to_keyboard = true ) const;
379
380 /**
381 * Get/Set edittext to display IME unspecified string.
382 */
383 void set_edittext( const std::string &s );
384 std::string get_edittext();
385
386 void set_iso( bool mode = true );
387
388 /**
389 * Sets input polling timeout as appropriate for the current interface system.
390 * Use this method to set timeouts when using input_context, rather than calling
391 * the old timeout() method or using input_manager::(re)set_timeout, as using
392 * this method will cause input_event_t::timeout events to be generated correctly,
393 * and will reset timeout correctly when a new input context is entered.
394 */
395 void set_timeout( int val );
396 void reset_timeout();
397
398 input_event first_unassigned_hotkey( const hotkey_queue &queue ) const;
399 input_event next_unassigned_hotkey( const hotkey_queue &queue, const input_event &prev ) const;
400 private:
401
402 std::vector<std::string> registered_actions;
403 std::string edittext;
404 public:
405 const std::string &input_to_action( const input_event &inp ) const;
406 bool is_event_type_enabled( input_event_t type ) const;
407 bool is_registered_action( const std::string &action_name ) const;
408 private:
409 bool registered_any_input;
410 std::string category; // The input category this context uses.
411 point coordinate;
412 bool coordinate_input_received;
413 bool handling_coordinate_input;
414 input_event next_action;
415 bool iso_mode = false; // should this context follow the game's isometric settings?
416 int timeout = -1;
417 keyboard_mode preferred_keyboard_mode = keyboard_mode::keycode;
418
419 /**
420 * When registering for actions within an input_context, callers can
421 * specify a custom action name that will override the action's normal
422 * name. This map stores those overrides. The key is the action ID and the
423 * value is the user-visible name.
424 */
425 std::map<std::string, translation> action_name_overrides;
426
427 /**
428 * Returns whether action uses the specified input
429 */
430 bool action_uses_input( const std::string &action_id, const input_event &event ) const;
431 /**
432 * Return a user presentable list of actions that conflict with the
433 * proposed keybinding. Returns an empty string if nothing conflicts.
434 */
435 std::string get_conflicts( const input_event &event, const std::string &ignore_action ) const;
436 /**
437 * Clear an input_event from all conflicting keybindings (excluding conflicts for `ignore_action`) that are
438 * registered by this input_context in default and current context (see `category`).
439 *
440 * @param event The input event to be cleared from conflicting
441 * keybindings.
442 */
443 void clear_conflicting_keybindings( const input_event &event, const std::string &ignore_action );
444 /**
445 * Find all conflicts for all `events` (excluding conflicts for `ignore_action`).
446 * If there are any, prompt the user "Should they be cleared?".
447 * Then, clear all input_events from all conflicting keybindings (actions)
448 * in both the default and current context (see `category`).
449 *
450 * @param events The input events to be cleared from conflicting actions
451 * @return true if cleared (user agreed) or if no conflicts found
452 */
453 bool resolve_conflicts( const std::vector<input_event> &events, const std::string &ignore_action );
454 /**
455 * Filter a vector of strings by a phrase, returning only strings that contain the phrase.
456 *
457 * @param strings The vector of strings to filter
458 * @param phrase The phrase to search within each of the given strings
459 * @return A vector of the filtered strings
460 */
461 std::vector<std::string> filter_strings_by_phrase( const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
462 std::string_view phrase ) const;
463
464 action_id display_menu_legacy( bool permit_execute_action );
465#if !defined(__ANDROID__)
466 action_id display_menu_imgui( bool permit_execute_action );
467#endif
468};
469
470class hotkey_queue
471{
472 public:
473 // ctxt is only used for determining hotkey input type
474 // use input_context::first_unassigned_hotkey() instead to skip assigned actions
475 input_event first( const input_context &ctxt ) const;
476 // use input_context::next_unassigned_hotkey() instead to skip assigned actions
477 input_event next( const input_event &prev ) const;
478
479 /**
480 * In keychar mode:
481 * a-z, A-Z
482 * In keycode mode:
483 * a-z, shift a-z
484 */
485 static const hotkey_queue &alphabets();
486
487 /**
488 * In keychar mode:
489 * 1-0, a-z, A-Z
490 * In keycode mode:
491 * 1-0, a-z, shift 1-0, shift a-z
492 */
493 static const hotkey_queue &alpha_digits();
494
495 private:
496 std::vector<int> codes_keychar;
497 std::vector<int> codes_keycode;
498 std::vector<std::set<keymod_t>> modifiers_keycode;
499};
